channel.itunes:author: PodcastOne
channel.title: Gals on the Go
channel.description:
Gals on the Go is a lifestyle podcast hosted by influencers and YouTubers Danielle Carolan and Brooke Miccio. Starting in 2018, this weekly podcast highlights conversations about friendship, navigating your 20’s + early adulthood, social media trends, relationships, family and so much more. Gals on the Go focuses on having real, raw, and honest conversations in an effort to “pull back the curtain” on what may look like perfect and glamorous lives on social media. STAY TUNED FOR NEW EPISODES EVERY WEDNESDAY! 

For Business Inquiries, contact GalsOnTheGoPodcastTeam@unitedtalent.com

item.title: wedding etiquette, dating app tips & moving in with we met at acme
item.itunes:title: wedding etiquette, dating app tips & moving in with we met at acme
item.description:
Brooke and Danielle are joined by Lindsey Metselaar from We Met at Acme to discuss wedding culture, dating, moving in with a significant other, and so much more! Tune in to hear what Lindsey has to say about wedding gifts, wedding style, bachelorette parties, bridal showers and engagement parties. Plus, Lindsey gives tips for using dating apps + dating post-grad! Be sure to tag @galsonthegopodcast Daniellecarolan and @brookemiccio in your listening selfies and stories on Instagram!
Please support the show by checking out our sponsors!

item.title: the internet raised us
item.itunes:title: the internet raised us
item.description:
Brooke and Danielle are getting nostalgic and talking all about YouTube through the years! The gals have been making videos for over ten years now, and they have seen the platform and the social media landscape change over time. Join Brooke and Danielle as they get reflective on popular videos, trends, influencers, and so much more! Be sure to tag @galsonthegopodcast @daniellecarolan and @brookemiccio in your listening selfies and stories on Instagram!

item.title: clara peirce: cleaning and organizing 101
item.itunes:title: clara peirce: cleaning and organizing 101
item.description:
Brooke and Danielle joined by new friend Clara Peirce to discuss cleaning, organization, bunnies, and so much more. You may know Clara from her well-edited TikTok videos cleaning her apartment, or making cute cocktails with friends. The gals also get into things they are loving at the moment and product recs! Be sure to tag @clarapeirce and @galsonthegopodcast in your listening selfies and stories on Instagram!
Please support the show by checking out our sponsors!

item.title: ADVICE: dating, being the “single friend” + making the first move
item.itunes:title: ADVICE: dating, being the “single friend” + making the first move
item.description:
Brooke and Danielle are getting into your submissions today and giving some advice! The gals answer questions about being the single friend, moving on, making the first move, dealing with your partner’s friends, and so much more. The gals also catch up on Danielle’s recent move and Brooke’s trip to Florida that was cut short. Be sure to tag @galsonthegopodcast in your listening selfies and stories on Instagram!

item.description:

Danielle shares stories from her time at her family reunion in Illinois, and Brooke discusses her visit to Atlantic City. Brooke and Danielle talk about swimming lessons, trivia games and all of the VARIOUS eras the gals are in. The gals have an interesting few weeks coming up, so stay tuned for all of the fun. item.description:

item.title: advice from mom (that you NEED to hear) ft Adina Miccio
item.itunes:title: advice from mom (that you NEED to hear) ft Adina Miccio
item.description:
Brooke is solo this week - so she decided to bring on her Mom! Adina and Brooke discuss the best life advice for your 20’s, working while being a mom, body confidence, party hosting tips, etiquette tips, reality TV, skincare/hair care tips and so much more! Brooke also begins the episode catching everyone up on her life and discusses her recent COVID experience as well as quarantining with her new boyfriend. Be sure to tag @galsonthegopodcast in your listening selfies/stories!

Brooke and Danielle are BACK this week and debriefing on the weeks events in the city. The gals attended a party with many NYC TikTokers, many of which were exactly as they appear online, but others were not. The gals also dive into some advice for moving to a completely new city, practical tips for putting yourself out there, and how to navigate a lot of change. item.title: catch up with brooke! 1 year of living in NYC + life updates
item.itunes:title: catch up with brooke! 1 year of living in NYC + life updates
item.description:
It’s been a crazy summer in NYC for Brooke and she is catching you up on all of it! Brooke shares some of her favorites spots in NYC, and what she suggests you do if you come and visit the Lower East Side/East Village area. Brooke also updates us on her dating life, her upcoming move, and friendships in the city. It’s a jam packed episode getting into all things summer in the city! Be sure to tag @galsonthegopodcast in your listening stories + screenshots on Instagram.

item.itunes:title: GIRL TALK: body hair, sex (getting real), body image
item.description:
Brooke and Danielle are back together this week for a GIRL TALK! The gals discuss some topics you may or may not get into with your friends such as dealing with body hair, hair down there, and how they feel in terms of body confidence/bikini confidence heading into the summer. The gals also dive into sex and answer some of your more intimate sex questions! Be sure to post your listening screenshots/selfies and of course tag @galsonthegopodcast.

Brooke and Danielle are joined by Grace Ann, a future lawyer and NY based vlogger! The gals discuss what taking the LSAT is like, applying to law school, how Grace knew law was for her, what type of law she is in now and more! Grace recently passed the bar (congrats to her!) so listen closely to her study tips, time management tactics and how she organizes her life.

item.title: how to turn your life around + get out of a slump (for real)
item.itunes:title: how to turn your life around + get out of a slump (for real)
item.description:
Brooke and Danielle are solo on the podcast today and getting deep about periods of their lives they were in a “slump” and how they overcame those. The gals share tips on turning your life around, removing bad friends/relationships from your life + overall making positive changes in your life!
TW: This episode might not be for you if you are struggling with issues of Depression, Anxiety and/or other mental health concerns.

item.title: how to make big changes in life: veganism + sobriety
item.itunes:title: how to make big changes in life: veganism + sobriety
item.description:
The gals are joined by Remy Park from @veggiekins to dive into all things vegan lifestyle related, sobriety, and recovery. Remy opens up more about her journey to finding this lifestyle, nutrition, meal ideas, and more on her past experiences with drugs/alcohol. Remy is a vegan food blogger and also shares more on her recipe creation process and day-to-day life. The gals also catch up on their favorite TV shows at the moment as well as sharing some recent lessons they have learned.
TW: This episode might not be for you if topics around diet, eating disorders, drug/alcohol abuse are triggering for you.

item.description:
Brooke and Danielle are solo this week and getting deep about growing up and adulthood! With Danielle graduating in just a few months and Brooke turning 24 in a few months, the gals are talking about the pressures of being at these various points in life. Brooke and Danielle are joined by RGR aka Rish to discuss her crazy life! Rish moved to NYC while taking a gap semester from UC Berkley to pursue fashion. item.title: Why I Took 2 Months Off Social Media | I’m Back
item.itunes:title: Why I Took 2 Months Off Social Media | I’m Back
item.description: Hello everyone it’s Danielle and I am sooo happy to be back on the podcast I have missed you guys so much and thanks so much to Brooke for killing it while I was gone! Today’s solo episode will be an extension of my last YouTube video (youtube.com/daniellecarolan) about where I’ve been and where I am going from here. I will be expanding on my meetings with Hanna on interrupting daily acts of oppression and what I learned from those meetings. I then talk about how being back at college is, the classes I’m taking, and more. Enjoy. See you guys next week reunited with Brooke.

item.title: What You Don’t Know About TikTok Icon Audrey Peters: Dating, Confidence, College & Work
item.itunes:title: What You Don’t Know About TikTok Icon Audrey Peters: Dating, Confidence, College & Work
item.description:

item.itunes:title: Starting a Business + Working in Tech With Sonali Karmarkar
item.description:
Brooke chats with Sonali Karmarkar, Founder & CEO of Soieli - a wearable hair art company.  On top of having her own business, Sonali also works for Google.  The two discuss starting a company, being a one woman show, college/internship advice and more!  Be sure to enter the giveaway with Soieli on the @galsonthegopodcast instagram now!

item.itunes:title: Working in STEM, Managing a Side Hustle & Life in NYC with Gabby Whiten

Brooke is joined by Gabby Whiten - a full time NYU PhD student currently working full time in a research lab, all while building her own brand encompassing a YouTube channel, blog, and all forms of social media.  The duo discuss working in STEM, being a multi-faceted person, if “balance” is really a thing and more.

item.title: Learning to TRULY love myself (Body Positivity + Acceptance)
item.itunes:title: Learning to TRULY love myself (Body Positivity + Acceptance)
item.description:
Solo episode with Brooke this week where she discusses tips on body acceptance based on her journey of getting confortable with her own body. She also answers some questions related to her realtionship with Danielle and the dating scene. 

Black-Owned Business of the Week:

https://kncbeauty.com/ 

Listen to Blood Ties Season 2 on the Wondery app. Download it today to join Wondery+ with a free trial to enjoy ad free listening, exclusives, binges and early access. Get it here: 

https://wondery.app.link/UpmaC6vYI7 

 Wondery’s hit audio drama “Blood Ties” is back for a second season with Josh Gad & Gillian Jacobs returning as Michael and Elenore Richland. This season they are joined by Dominic Monaghan (“Lost”) as David Hammer the new CEO of Richland Health and Wayne Knight as Peter Richland. 

 Season one was all about questions. What did Peter Richland do? How far will Richland Health go to bury the story? And when faced with the choice of telling the truth or losing billions what side would Michael and Elenore fall on. Season two is all about answers.

item.title: Pep Talk with Tori DeSimone | Entrepreneur Life, YT Culture, Budgeting and more!
item.itunes:title: Pep Talk with Tori DeSimone | Entrepreneur Life, YT Culture, Budgeting and more!
item.description:
Danielle & Brooke are back at it for your mid-week hang with High lights & Low lights, and current favorites of the week! PLUS, Brooke sits down with fellow YouTuber and co-owner of STRIDE Spin & Fitness, Tori DeSimone! Tori discusses her journey getting started on YouTube and her experiences with the culture, thoughts behind her decision to leave the University of Alabama, and how she opened her own fitness studio! PLUS, Tori gives some tips on how to stay motivated and budget as a young entrepreneur, and how she balances it all!

Check Out Tori ! @toristerling_

Check out stRIDE! @stridespinandfitness

item.title: Bonus - Sneak Peek of 22 Hours: An American Nightmare
item.itunes:title: Bonus - Sneak Peek of 22 Hours: An American Nightmare
item.description:
It’s a case nightmares are made of. We’ve got your sneak peek into the new true-crime series, 22 Hours: An American Nightmare. It's the frightening story of a D.C. power couple, their 10-year-old son, and housekeeper who were held hostage, tortured, and brutally murdered inside their burning D.C. mansion. You won’t believe what happened during those last 22 hours alive, and the shocking trail of evidence that led police to the killer! Did he have help? Hear from key witnesses who reveal never-before heard details. Will this investigation lead to the release of newly-discovered and confidential audio recordings so the public can hear the trial for the first time ever? Listen to the first episode now: http://bit.ly/2XDFub0

New episodes will be available every Monday on PodcastOne.com and Apple Podcasts. 

Don’t forget to subscribe, rate and review!

item.itunes:title: Summer Plans & Life Changes
item.description:
Today, Brooke and Danielle share with us a bit about what their summer will look like! Between travels, starting new jobs and internships and moving, things will be getting busy!

And remember, for a limited time, if you head to the App Store or Google Play and sign up for Drop using code GALS you’ll receive a $10 Starbucks gift card right away!  

And be sure to check out hellofresh.com and enter promo code GalsOnTheGo80!

You can check out our channels on YouTube:

Brooke Miccio

Danielle Carolan

item.title: Starting a Company: Get to Know Julia Haber the Founder of WAYV
item.itunes:title: Starting a Company: Get to Know Julia Haber the Founder of WAYV
item.description:
In this week's episode we sit down in NYC to interview Julia Haber, founder of WAYV. We chat about her college experience, starting her own company, Danielle's internship with her this summer, AND we get a wonderful story time from Brooke and hear about how she broke her wrist - enjoy!
Follow @ourwayv Follow Julia @juliahaber
You can check out our channels on YouTube: Brooke Miccio Danielle Carolan
Follow @galsonthegopodcast on Instagram to submit your own questions for next week’s episode, get involved, and more!

item.title: Yoga Tips, Our Family Dynamic, & Communication Skills with Momma Carolan!
item.itunes:title: Yoga Tips, Our Family Dynamic, & Communication Skills with Momma Carolan!
item.description:
SURPRISE! This is a BONUS EPISODE WOO WOO. Danielle here! My mom and I wanted to do a mother daughter episode as well before I head back to college for second semester. We talk about a lot of your questions - how my mom and dad stay friends after divorce, how she became a yoga instructor, her tips on yoga for beginners, how to keep a good relationship with your parents, our favorite memories together, our differences, and so so much more. I really hope you guys enjoy this episode. There will be A NEW episode with Brooke and I this Wednesday as usual too. Enjoy.
Check out my momma on the 'gram lol: @peacefulmichelle
OUR CURRENT FAVORITES: Danielle - Windsor Smith Sneakers: http://bit.ly/2Ciwrnz Michelle - Steve Madden Platform Loafers: http://bit.ly/2TBeOpd
You can check out our channels on YouTube:
Brooke Miccio Danielle Carolan
Follow @galsonthegopodcast on Instagram to submit your own questions for next week’s episode, get involved, and more!

item.title: My Mid-Senior Year Life Crisis
item.itunes:title: My Mid-Senior Year Life Crisis
item.description:
This week Brooke is here for a solo episode discussing the answer to the most asked question: what do you want to do with the rest of your life? Other things such as Internship tips, career choices and post-grad plans are also discussed in today's ep! Sit back, relax, and remember it is OK to not know what you wanna do with your life!
Current Favorite: Brooke - MUSIC! Ariana Grande "Imagine"

item.itunes:title: Gals on the Go Master List: Our 40 Favorite Products of All Time
item.description:
The longest podcast episode yet! We catch you guys up on our Thanksgiving breaks, Brooke’s macarena meltdown, Danielle’s obsession with Drake, and not to mention our 40 favorite products - fashion, beauty, lifestyle. Consider it the Gals on the Go Master List! Enjoy
Thanks to our sponsor, Hint Water!
To receive 36 bottles for $36, visit drinkhint.com/galsonthego and use promo code galsonthego.
THE GALS ON THE GO MASTER LIST:
BROOKE'S FAVORITES:
Sara happ lip slip https://go.magik.ly/ml/hyrw/ Drunk Elephant Lip Balm https://go.magik.ly/ml/hyrx/ Fenty lip gloss https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys1/ Brazilian bum bum cream https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys0/ Beauty blender https://amzn.to/2Qj9KaY Drunk Elephant polypeptide cream https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys2/ Drunk Elephant glycolic night serum https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys3/ Neutrogena gentle face wash https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys4/ Summer Fridays Mask - https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys8/ Mac studio fix powder - https://go.magik.ly/ml/hys9/ urban decay All nighter setting spray - https://go.magik.ly/ml/hysb/ Nike air force 1 - https://go.magik.ly/ml/fs5b/ Lululemon align leggings - https://go.magik.ly/ml/hysc/ Colgate optic radiant https://go.magik.ly/ml/hysj/ Phillips sonjcare electric toothbrush https://go.magik.ly/ml/hysk/ Hydroflask w straw https://amzn.to/2zsZPWG LV neverfull tote https://go.magik.ly/ml/hysm/ Airpods https://amzn.to/2DYC8t0 Pilot g-2 pens https://go.magik.ly/ml/hysn/ Day Designer Agenda https://amzn.to/2DIME6S
DANIELLE'S FAVORITES:
DryBar Buttercup Blow Dryer:https://go.magik.ly/ml/hziw/ DryBar Baby Buttercup Blow Dryer: https://go.magik.ly/ml/hzj0/ Foreo Luna Mini: https://go.magik.ly/ml/hzj1/ Dr. Brandt Pores No More Primer: http://bit.ly/2JTkJRP Tarte Shape Tape Concealer: http://bit.ly/2CTdEjB White Vince Slip On Sneakers: https://rstyle.me/n/dckxvibwzyp Mejuri Gold Rings: https://mejuri.com/shop/products/stacker-ring https://mejuri.com/shop/products/beaded-stackable-ring-2 https://mejuri.com/shop/products/bold-stacker Fashion Nova Jeans: https://www.fashionnova.com/collections/distressed-ripped-jeans/products/blanched-jeans-black https://www.fashionnova.com/collections/boyfriend-mom-jeans/products/i-want-you-back-boyfriend-jeans-medium-blue-wash Glossier Jelly Cleanser: https://rstyle.me/n/dckxisbwzyp Exfolikate by Kate Somerville: https://go.magik.ly/ml/hzj7/

item.title: How to Push Through The Rest of The Semester: Motivation & Top Tips
item.itunes:title: How to Push Through The Rest of The Semester: Motivation & Top Tips
item.description:
In today's episode we are bringing it back to what we know best... school! The end of the semester is extremely difficult to push through with lack of motivation, however it is typically the most critical time in terms of final exams and securing those grades you want to get! What are your top tips? Share with us on our instagram or in our NEW private Facebook group.
Join the Gals on The Go Facebook Group Here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1129205203923283/

item.title: Q+A: Life Catch Up, Favorites, Some Laughs, & More!
item.itunes:title: Q+A: Life Catch Up, Favorites, Some Laughs, & More!

item.title: Life Post-Grad & Working a Non-Traditional Career: Morgan Yates
item.itunes:title: Life Post-Grad & Working a Non-Traditional Career: Morgan Yates
item.description:
Today’s episode is SUPER exciting.. We have our FIRST special guest on the show! Morgan Yates just graduated from UNC Chapel Hill and moved out to Los Angeles to pursue her career on YouTube. Morgan creates lifestyle videos and vlogs covering all the bases. Today we interviewed Morgan about her post-grad life, how she decided she didn’t want to pursue a corporate job right out of college, and her experiences along the way. Not to mention, Morgan is one of our best friends! Enjoy!
For 25% off your first month of personalized Care/of vitamins, visit TakeCareOf.com and enter “galsonthego"
You can check out our channels on YouTube:
Brooke Miccio Danielle Carolan Morgan Yates
Follow @galsonthegopodcast on Instagram to submit your own questions for next week’s episode, get involved, and more!
For business inquiries email rene@beaufreshmedia.comwith “Gals On the Go Podcast” in the subject! Follow us on Instagram and Twitter to be involved in the next episode’s Q&A: @daniellecarolan @brookemiccio Talk to you guys next Wednesday and for the next episode!
**If you are a graphic designer or could help us with creating a Jingle, submit some of your past work to brookeanddaniellepodcast@gmail.com!
Buy Tickets to Meet Danielle at Stay You Orlando with Joey Kidney on Friday, November 2nd from 5-8:30 https://pressplay.ticketleap.com/StayYou-Orlando/

item.title: Dating In College: Being Single and Our Experiences
item.itunes:title: Dating In College: Being Single and Our Experiences
item.description: In this episode, we recap our weekend in Atlanta at Music Midtown, a two day music festival, talk about what “blow out styles” we get at the Dry Bar. Highlights and lowlights of this last week. But most importantly… B O Y S! We don’t often talk about dating, but so many of you asked us to do an episode about boys, dating in college, being single, and everything like that. So here we go! We talk about our experience with it all, and answer TONS of your questions. You can check out our channels on YouTube: Brooke Miccio Danielle Carolan Follow @galsonthegopodcast on Instagram to submit your own questions for next week’s episode, get involved, and more! For business inquiries email rene@beaufreshmedia.com with “Gals On the Go Podcast” in the subject! Follow us on Instagram and Twitter to be involved in the next episode’s Q&A: @daniellecarolan @brookemiccio Talk to you guys next Wednesday and for the next episode!

item.title: Insider’s Guide To Youtube: Sponsorships, Travels, and Keeping it Real
item.itunes:title: Insider’s Guide To Youtube: Sponsorships, Travels, and Keeping it Real
item.description: In this episode, we talk about Youtube: the Good, the Bad, and the Ugly. Think of this as an insider’s guide to YouTube. We talk about working with brands, how we make money, when we realized YouTube could be a career, address “drama” in the YouTube community, how much we love our YouTube friends, what it’s like going to events and VIP parties, brand trips, and more! You can check out our channels on YouTube: Brooke Miccio Danielle Carolan For business inquiries email rene@beaufreshmedia.com with “Gals On the Go Podcast” in the subject! item.title: How to De-Stress, Study Tips, and Time Management
item.itunes:title: How to De-Stress, Study Tips, and Time Management
item.description: In this episode, we give tons of tips on time management, effective study habits, and how to de-stress when life gets crazy and overwhelming. For business inquiries email rene@beaufreshmedia.com with “Gals On the Go Podcast” in the subject! Follow us on Instagram and Twitter to be involved in the next episode’s Q&A: @daniellecarolan @brookemiccio Talk to you guys next Wednesday and for the next episode!

item.title: Back to School & Getting Into a Routine
item.itunes:title: Back to School & Getting Into a Routine
item.description: In this episode, we talk about our first week back at the University of Georgia, our favorite classes and least favorite classes so far, a quick Bachelorette recap because we couldn't help ourselves, back to school routines, and easy healthy meal ideas for gals on the go! For business inquiries email rene@beaufreshmedia.com with "Gals On The Go Podcast" in the subject! Follow us on Instagram and Twitter to be involved in the next episode's Q&A: @daniellecarolan @brookemiccio Talk to you guys next Wednesday for the next episode!

item.title: Summer Catch Up: Internships, Travels & A Few Laughs
item.itunes:title: Summer Catch Up: Internships, Travels & A Few Laughs
item.description: So excited to be back in Athens together! Welcome to our first official podcast episode of Gals on the Go. We totally bummed out for this episode eating Uber Eats in our Nike shorts and t-shirts recapping on our summer travels, internships, and hilarious encounters. We also introduce you to the episode format and how each one will work. It is so fun to be doing this together as best friends. We really hope you guys enjoy our first podcast. Rate us if you enjoyed it and expect a NEW podcast every week. Lots of love, Brooke & Danielle @daniellecarolan @brookemiccio
